body.name: Joovy Kooper X2 Side-by-Side Double Stroller Featuring Dual Snack Trays, One-Handed Fold, Multi-Position Reclining Seats, Adjustable Leg Rests, and 2 Zippered Pockets for Storage, Forged Iron
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 19 hrs 45 mins
features: UNIQUE, COMPACT TRI-FOLD DESIGN makes this twin stroller ideal for small cars with limited cargo space
BIG WHEELS that give little ones a smooth ride, even when pushed one-handed
DUAL SNACK TRAYS with built-in cup holders. And when it’s time to get out the snack trays swing open
TWO ZIPPERED STORAGE POCKETS too keep your personal items secure and an extra-large storage basket for all the essentials
MULTIPLE SEAT RECLINE POSITIONS and adjustable footrests so each of your little ones can customize their ride, making this a perfect toddler stroller
ROOM TO GROW with wide seats and extra headroom for another year or two extra use out of this side by side double stroller
TWO EXTRA-LARGE, WATER REPELLENT CANOPIES with peek-a-boo screens provide UPF 50 sun protection from almost any angle for bright days
SUPER EASY ONE-HANDED FOLD and locks into place to make this toddler and baby stroller easy to handle
BUILT FOR FAMILY, DESIGNED FOR LIFE - Joovy believes that happy, healthy parents produce happy, healthy children and the KooperX2 is designed to be a truly portable compact double stroller
body.description: Joovy is an American company that makes vibrant, high-quality gear for your family. All their products, from high chairs to double strollers, have been designed to be useful, dependable, and just plain FUN. Say goodbye to ugly patterns and throwaway construction: you can use Joovy's products until they've been run ragged. Joovy's KooperX2 is a compact double stroller that is tough and lightweight at once. The KooperX2 has 2 deep set, swing open trays, so no one will kick the tray and lose their snacks on their way off the stroller, as well as Joovy's signature one-step linked brake, to stop any runaways before they start. The KooperX2 was designed for comfort: it features the biggest wheels of any comparable stroller on the market, as well as extra spacious, reclining seats for just kicking back and relaxing. As you've come to expect with all of Joovy's products, the KooperX2 has undergone extensive safety testing and is manufactured without flame-retardant chemicals or other harmful industrial materials. It comes in six colors--black, blue, gray, olive, paprika, and sand--and measures 34.5" L x 21" W x 41" H.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Premium Travel Compact Fold Double Stroller The ONLY compact double stroller in the US with trays that folds with it

Previous page Adjustable Dual Canopies With an option to extend even more with zipper, UPF 50 sun protection and a mesh peek-a-boo window Trays that fold WITH the stroller Featuring extra-deep cup holds and a swing-open, no-kick design Built-In Storage Zippered pockets and mesh cup holders Flip-flop Friendly Parking Brake One tap locks and unlocks both sides Compact One-Handed Standing Fold Just weighs 28 lbs., making the Kooper a perfect option for travel Next page 1 Canopy 2 Trays 3 Parent Organizer 4 Brake 5 Fold

The Compact Stroller That Conquers Two Lightweight Travel Friendly At just 28 lbs., the Kooper X2 folds compactly (WITH THE TRAYS) for travel. With extra storage is great for families on-the-go. Built-In Comfort The Kooper X2 features dual seats with independently adjustable reclining options. The extra-wide seats offer maximum comfort as your children grow. Deluxe Canopies The extendable canopies function independently from one another, offer UPF 50 sun protection and have a peek-a-boo window to check on the littles. Side-by-Side Benefit So your kids don't fight over the front seat, the Kooper X2 is a side by side that fits through doorways and checkout aisles!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jack of all trades
reviews.reviewText: Ok, I have 6 kids and have used a lot of strollers, but for this season of life, this stroller is THE BEST. Let me explain why so you can decide if it’s the best for you too.What’s GREAT (I haven’t found a stroller that does it better):Snack trays - It comes with snack trays!!!Toddlers need snacks to be happy. Therefore, snack trays make me happy.Baskets - The baskets are amazing - you can reach them from the front and back, they are big, and they hold a lot of weight.Foot lock - The lock is really easy to use, you can do it in a flip flop without chipping your polish 💁‍♀️.Here’s what’s GOOD (and I only say good and not great because there might be a stroller that does it better, there just isn’t another stroller does does all of these things together better):Fold - It’s a two hand fold for me. I’ve had one hand fold strollers so it gets a B in this category but even two handed it’s a very easy fold.Weight - A couple of strollers are lighter but this one is more than reasonable for my 5’3”, 120# self to throw in the van.Compact - We had major problems fitting all of our other strollers in the very small space behind our cargo van seats but this one fits! It’s a very flat fold.Width - There are skinnier strollers but I haven’t found a doorway we didn’t fit through yet.Sunshade - It honestly feels flimsy but I think it’s a deceptively strong fabric because I abuse it daily and there are no holes. It’s big enough (there are bigger) and it has a zipper to look through/move it lower. If you want a clear window to look through this stroller doesn’t have it. But I just peek around and look? Not having a window is a non-issue for me.Seats - They aren’t completely flat but they are pretty close. Good enough for my 3 month old to being able to ride in and my 18 month old to nap in. They are a little tedious to put back up but most are. Especially at this price point. It’s still easier than my bob 🤷‍♀️. Their width is great for now but if you’ve got really big kids might get a little tight. Part of the sacrifice for a skinny stroller though.Off road capability - This is not an off road stroller. If your priority is a smooth ride on rocky terrain get a bob. It’s the best. But that sucker is heavy and bulky!! And you know what?? This stroller is pretty darn good! I’ve taken it to baseball, soccer, horseback riding and it’s done exceptional. I’m not going on a hike with it or in the sand but it holds its own on a wide variety of terrain and is still really easy to push with no instability.Price - For what you get, not bad! But it sure would be nice if strollers weren’t a car payment 🤪.Hope this helps someone on the fence! If you have a very specific need in one category this may not be the stroller for you but if you need a jack of all trades, pretty great at everything stroller, this one’s for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent double stroller
reviews.reviewText: After one year of frequent use, I am still in love with this stroller. It was the product of hours of research, and it was definitely the best choice we could have made. This stroller has lasted through many airports, amusement parks, bumpy sidewalks, and fairs full of gravel paths and grassy fields and is still going strong.The number one benefit of this stroller is the maneuverability. I can navigate crowded zoo sidewalks with one hand while holding a screaming baby in the other. When the toddler wants to walk, I can hold his hand while still pushing the baby with the other. It is SO EASY to push! It’s definitely not made for off-roading, so some gravel paths can be hard, but overall it still does the trick no matter where we are.My husband didn’t want a side by side because he was convinced it wouldn’t fit through doorways. He’s now sold on this stroller and recommends it to everyone. We’ve never had a problem with the width in our year of use. It’s narrow enough to maneuver easily through crowds and doorways, and I love that the kids can sit beside each other and get up and down easily.The stroller is lightweight with plenty of storage. The materials seemed cheap at first, but it’s held up very well over the past year (and we haven’t gone easy on it!) I love the zip pockets on the back for my phone and keys!The only con for me is the recline. It is tricky to recline and the stroller has to be stopped and locked to do it. It makes it difficult when trying to keep sleeping babies sleeping! Overall, not a dealbreaker for us as everything else is so perfect!If you have two little ones, buy this stroller!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We absolutely love this stroller. We initially purchased a cheaper stroller but it didn’t seem like it was going to last. My son is: 3 years old, 38 inches tall and 35 pounds, so he is on the bigger side. He fits comfortably and loves sitting in it. We did always leave the seat extender out for him because of his size, but it seemed sturdy. My daughter is on the smaller side: 2 years old, 32 inches tall and 22 pounds, so she doesn’t need the leg extender out but she likes to leave it out since her brother does. We bought this stroller for an upcoming trip to Florida and I expect it to work next year as well. For an overview, the stroller pushes incredibly smoothly and can even be maneuvered one handed if needed. The storage space is great we can fit our large diaper bag under one side and a backpack under the other side. The tray is a really nice feature and was well designed. It is easy to take on and off and you can even drop down one side they can get out easier, since the tray joint swivels. The tray can be left on when folded or removed to make it more compact. The shade is nice and can close almost to the tray it also has a nice peak a boo window to check on sleeping kids. Opening and closing the stroller is really easy and it is a nice shape when folded. It also stands on its own which is so helpful when juggling kids and suitcases. Ultimately, I am so glad we decided to make the invest in a stroller that will last longer. Plus my kids loved it!
Es la carriola indicada , cómprala ! No lo dudes. Los materiales son de súper calidad, cabe en la cajuela de un auto , el manejo es realmente cómodo. Amo este cochecito.

Ein reinfall. was wirklich das wichtigste unteranderem ist .3.11.2021 nachtragAuf der linken seite siehe bilder schraube defekt lose ist während der fahr zusammengekippt , gefählich für 2kleine kinder drinn waren und vorallem 45max körpergewicht ich hatte es 329 euro gekauft nund kostet das gleiche kinderwaagen 399 euro.... hmm

Got this for my twins after contemplating for some time as most double strollers are bulky.Super easy to do one hand fold, and due to it being trifold, it becomes compact enough to bring onto car boots/taxis. The length fits doorways and lifts easily here in SG too, that’s a plus. Love that it comes with removable snack trays which doubles like a belly bar which most double strollers don’t have.
